item.title: CSIS Economic Security and Technology Department Names Angela Paolini Ellard as Non-Resident Senior Adviser
item.description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) today announced that Angela Ellard has been appointed as non-resident senior adviser with the CSIS Economic Security and Technology (EST) Department.

item.title: Chinese Buoys Near the South Korea-China PMZ
item.description: China’s deployment of buoys near the Korea-China PMZ signals expanding monitoring and gray zone pressure in the Yellow Sea (West Sea).

item.title: Universities, Patents, and the Future of U.S. Competitiveness
item.description: The strength of the United States’ innovation system does not rest on government spending alone, but on the mutually supportive partnership between public investment, university research, and private enterprise.

item.title: The United States Needs Its Marine Corps Now More Than Ever
item.description: Recent arguments for abolishing the Marine Corps on the grounds of redundancy and fiscal constraints overlook the service's unique role as a scalable, naval expeditionary force essential for power projection and sea control in the era of great power competition.

item.title: Everything Old Is New Again
item.description: In this commentary, Bill Reinsch looks back at past trade analysis that got it right and saw today's trade challenges before everyone else saw them coming, with takeaways for today's leaders.
